claims.claim: Lists module structure: v1.rs, v2.rs, common.rs, migrate.rs
claims.evidence: src/schema/ structure explicitly lists: v1.rs (Legacy schema), v2.rs (Current canonical schema), common.rs (Shared types), migrate.rs (Migration logic)

Clearly explains: 'The canonical type pattern is implemented via re-exports and type aliasing in mod.rs' with code example showing 'pub use v2::Annotation; pub use v2::*;' and the three-point explanation of how it works

Explicitly states 'The parse_annotation() function (lines 23-44) is the single deserialization chokepoint' and emphasizes 'Transparent migration: All code reads/writes v2, migration happens transparently at deserialization boundary'

claims.claim: For v3: add v3.rs and v2_to_v3() migration
claims.evidence: Under 'FILES THAT CHANGE' section: '1. Create src/schema/v3.rs - Define the new v3::Annotation struct' and '3. Update src/schema/migrate.rs - Add function pub fn v2_to_v3(ann: v2::Annotation) -> v3::Annotation'

claims.claim: For v3: update type alias and parse_annotation()
claims.evidence: Under '2. Update src/schema/mod.rs' section: 'Update canonical re-exports: pub use v3::Annotation; pub use v3::*;' and 'Extend parse_annotation() match statement'

claims.claim: For v3: v1_to_v2() does NOT change (additive chain)
claims.evidence: Under 'FILES THAT DO NOT CHANGE' section explicitly states: 'All code outside src/schema/: CLI commands, agent loops, storage layers, export/import all continue working.'
